results.title: Hammers over the anvil
results.creator_credit: Ben Gannon, Ann Turner, Harvest Productions and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the stories of the same title by Alan Marshall, this is the story of a young boy who suffered many hardships in life, but none so savage as contracting polio and being unable to walk without crutches. Despite his affliction, he dreams of being a great horseman like the town’s hero, East Driscoll (Russell Crowe). Handsome and skilful, East is the most popular man in town, but as the boy discovers one summer, heroes can fall, and when East begins a passionate affair with an older woman, he comes face to face with a hard and cruel society with strict social taboos and even harsher penalties. It was a summer that would ultimately shape the rest of his life. NB: THIS PROGRAM IS RATED M. PARENTS SHOULD BE AWARE THAT IT IS SUITABLE FOR ADOLESCENTS ONLY.

results.title: Hamlet studies in interpretation
results.creator_credit: Richard Callanan and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This film shows two scenes from Hamlet, the Ophelia-Hamlet scene and the closet scene. The film demonstrates how different interpretation of the scenes by directors and actors may alter the impressions conveyed to the audience. Scenes are performed by Elizabeth Spriggs and Tom Chadbon.

results.title: Hamlet [Animated]
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Christopher Grace, Elizabeth Babakhina, Natalia Orlova and et al
results.brief_description: With two US Emmy Awards, “Shakespeare - Animated tales” has won a vast new audience with its skilful, 30 minute adaptations. This can be used as a companion piece to the study of “Hamlet”, however it is far too succinct a precis to be a useful study piece for serious students of the Bard.

results.title: Hamlet (Zeffirelli)
results.creator_credit: Dyson Lovell, World Icon, Nelson Films and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description: On a windswept battlement looming over a stormy sea, in a stone castle guarding a northern kingdom, a man stands alone, haunted by the mysteries of fate, love, violence, tenderness, revenge. Searching for the truth behind an evil deed which left his father dead and his mother sitting on a royal throne beside the murderer. Tortured by his inability to take action. Searching for his very soul. Hamlet, Prince of Denmark. This lavish production directed by Franco Zeffirelli has assembled a cast to infuse the Shakespearian classic with a new light. Starring Mel Gibson as Hamlet opposite Glenn Close in the role of Gertrude and a supporting cast that includes, Alan Bates, Paul Scofield, Ian Holm and Helena Bonham-Carter as Ophelia.

results.title: Hamlet (Richardson)
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures Industries and Tony Richardson
results.brief_description: Nicol Williamson plays Hamlet and Marianne Faithfull, Ophelia, in this version directed by Tony Richardson, filmed in London’s Round House Theatre. The strong close-ups emphasises the impact of the spoken word above all else in this production. The excellent cast includes Anthony Hopkins as Claudius, Judy Parfit as Gertrude and Gordon Jackson as Horatio.

results.title: Hamlet (Perspective)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Shakespeare in Perspective Series”.
Designed to give a greater understanding and appreciation of the play by placing it in its historical and social context and by stressing its relevance for a modern-day audience. Perspective offered by Clive James, writer and broadcaster.

results.title: Hamlet (Olivier)
results.brief_description: Olivier’s version of Hamlet was described by him as “an essay in Hamlet”. The text has been dramatically cut, the order transposed in places, and some new implications worked into the action.

constellations_other.name: A world of firsts
constellations_other.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

results.description: Olivier’s version of Hamlet was described by him as “an essay in Hamlet”. The text has been dramatically cut, the order transposed in places, and some new implications worked into the action. Technically the film makes use of a number of camera devices, particularly the travelling camera. The characterization does not depart from the traditional.
description_for_label: Olivier’s version of Hamlet was described by him as “an essay in Hamlet”. Technically the film makes use of a number of camera devices, particularly the travelling camera. The characterization does not depart from the traditional.

results.title: Hamlet (Kozintsev)
results.brief_description: In the opening sequence of this production the whole line of the film is boldly laid down. Hamlet gallops across the sands towards Elsinore, and into the great sombre castle; Claudius’ rule is proclaimed in the crowded courtyard; the drawbridge is slowly pulled up, shutting the castle in on itself. Where Kozintsev scores, consistently and impressively is through the elements outlined in the film’s vigorous introduction; the way he involves the onlookers of Elsinore in the action, and the way he uses the castle and the court to create a feeling of encirclement by iron, stone and the watchful eye of the courtiers. The emphasis is on speed, clarity, the flow of visual action. It cuts a firm, slashing line through the play.

results.title: Hamlet (BBC)
results.creator_credit: Cedric Messina, Rodney Bennett, Time-Life Television and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, falls into melancholia after the death of his father, the king. Claudius, his father’s brother, has assumed the throne and married Hamlet’s mother, Gertrude, within two months of the king’s death. The king’s ghost appears to his son, denounces Claudius for the murderer he is, and demands revenge. Hamlet pretends madness in order to avenge his father’s death. Ophelia’s rejection of his suit provides a plausible reason for this display of madness. Overcome by doubts about the validity of the king’s accusation Hamlet persuades some travelling players to re-enact the death of the king, eventually exposing Claudius as a murderer.

results.title: Hamersley 70
results.brief_description: A Survey of the Hamersley Range iron mining operations. Includes scenes of the excavation of the ore from Mount Tom Price, the 182 mile railway to Dampier - the port from which iron pellets are exported all over the world.
